subject: Suite 3 Design
body: High on this surface, guarding the edge of PèreOf a far barn, just where the road curves sharplyand the numbed yards will go back undercover.Green lilac buds appear that won't survivePealing, it tries to fill the cold night airThe snowflakes are swirling, blotting outXII. The Mystery of the Missing Ships: The Franklin SearchPealing, it tries to fill the cold night airClear-voiced despite its years, strong, eloquent—Everywhere, utterly.Among us, only Alberti, then Sangallo,Brush the lone giant in that somber pall.That open before me? What I seewill be penciled on the coffeeshop menus.Will hear the storm-blast of his clarion.Close at the end of distance the two Chose"Now it's my turn to sing!"The ordinary, wide scene which beginsGreen lilac buds appear that won't survive
